required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pediatric Pharmacokinetic (PK) Study of EXE844 Otic Suspension in Otitis Media at the Time of Tympanostomy Tube Insertion (OMTT)
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label, Single-Dose, Pharmacokinetic Study of EXE844 Sterile Otic Suspension, 0.3% in Pediatric Subjects Following Tympanostomy Tube Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to describe the pharmacokinetics (PK) of EXE844 Sterile Otic Suspension, 0.3% following a single bilateral ototopical dose in pediatric subjects, immediately after bilateral tympanostomy tube surgery.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, pre-dose 0 hour (up to 30 minutes prior to dose), 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 6 hours post-dose
primary_outcome.description: Based on serum samples collected at pre-determined nominal time points, dependent on observed concentrations. EXE844 (AL-60371) concentration values below the lower limit of quantification (<0.05 ng/mL) were replaced by one-half the lower limit of quantification in the calculation of the summary statistics. Similarly for EXE844 glucuronide metabolite (AL-91591), concentration values below the lower limit of quantification (<0.5 ng/mL) were replaced by one-half the lower limit of quantification in the calculation of the summary statistics.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, pre-dose 0 hour (up to 30 minutes prior to dose), 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 6 hours post-dose
primary_outcome.description: Based on serum samples collected at pre-determined nominal time points, dependent on observed concentrations. Similarly for EXE844 glucuronide metabolite (AL-91591), concentration values below the lower limit of quantification (<0.5 ng/mL) were replaced by one-half the lower limit of quantification in the calculation of the summary statistics.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve to the Last Quantifiable Sampling Time Point (AUC0-last)

clinical_study.condition: Otitis Media With Effusion in Children

arm_group.description: EXE844 Sterile Otic Suspension, 0.3%, single ototopical dose (4 drops) in each ear following tympanostomy tube insertion

facility.name: Contact Alcon Call Center for Trial Locations

link.description: Results from the Novartis Clinical Trial Results Website

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were recruited from 2 investigational sites located in the US.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All 14 enrolled participants were treated. This reporting group includes all enrolled participants (14).

group.title: EXE844
group.description: EXE844 Sterile Otic Suspension, 0.3%, single ototopical dose (4 drops) in each ear following tympanostomy tube insertion

baseline.population: This analysis population includes all participants who had tympanostomy tubes (TT) inserted, received a dose of study drug, had at least 1 plasma sample following study drug exposure, and had no collection or analytical deviations affecting the integrity of the pharmacokinetic (PK) data (PK Analysis Set).

group.title: EXE844
group.description: EXE844 Sterile Otic Suspension, 0.3%, single ototopical dose (4 drops) in each ear following tympanostomy tube insertion

outcome.title: Maximum Analyte Plasma Concentration (Cmax)
outcome.description: Based on serum samples collected at pre-determined nominal time points, dependent on observed concentrations. EXE844 (AL-60371) concentration values below the lower limit of quantification (<0.05 ng/mL) were replaced by one-half the lower limit of quantification in the calculation of the summary statistics. Similarly for EXE844 glucuronide metabolite (AL-91591), concentration values below the lower limit of quantification (<0.5 ng/mL) were replaced by one-half the lower limit of quantification in the calculation of the summary statistics.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1, pre-dose 0 hour (up to 30 minutes prior to dose), 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 6 hours post-dose
outcome.population: PK analysis set, with at least 1 post-dose quantifiable plasma concentration for each individual analyte [EXE844 (AL-60371) and EXE844 glucuronide metabolite (AL-91591)]

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events (AEs) were collected for the duration of a subjectâ€™s participation in the study (up to 20 days). AE reporting began after parent/legally authorized representative (LAR) signed informed consent and if applicable, after participant signed assent. AEs are reported as pre-treatment and treatment-emergent.
reported_events.desc: An AE was defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a subject who is administered a study treatment regardless of whether or not the event has a causal relationship with the treatment. AEs were obtained as solicited comments from the study participants and as observations by the Investigator as outlined in the study protocol.

group.title: Pre-treatment
group.description: All subjects who consented to participate in the study prior to the initiation of study treatment

group.title: EXE844
group.description: All participants who had TT inserted and received a dose of test article

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Sponsor reserves the right of prior review of any publication or presentation of information related to the study.
